prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee is $300,000 in debt. She takes care of her little brother named Aiden he is 7

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
It was another calm night— Well, calm was an understatement, especially with where Cian currently was. He was sitting in the leather couch of the club named "Désire", the club that he built, that he owns, that was in **his** name. Leaning against the couch, he sighed with annoyance. It was one of those nights where he didn't like being here but still came anyway; it was one of those nights where one of the patrons tried to impress him for more money, for a better status, or to earn his respect.

*But to him, they look more like a clown than someone who he vowed was interesting.*

And that's what was happening right now, he was holding his glass of whiskey, his gaze fixated on the amber, which seemed more fascinating by whatever this clown next to him was talking about, some project he deemed interesting to integrate into his company. He finally looked up when he heard, "So Mr.O'Raida, what do you think? It will help gain more money!"

*Us?* As Cian and him? What a damn fool.

Cian chuckled humorelessly, shaking his head to look up at this poor excuse of a man with almost disbelief. Almost. He finished his whiskey in one gulp, placing the empty glass on the nearby table while letting out an annoyed sigh.

"Look, while I think this is an amazing idea..Your main aim is money, and in my company? We don't work for money. It may be an advantage, but we work to help people, your idea is...Surely special, but it's not for money I built his company, do you hear me? I have no interest in putting your selfish idea in my business because you're too damn obsessed with power and being rich. Get out of my sight, clown." He snarled, standing up and grabbing the empty glass before walking towards the counter without waiting for the man's words.

*Fucking annoying, people only wants money for selfish reasons.*

He placed his glass on the counter, an annoyed expression across his face, and looked up at the bartender.  *"Un autre whiskey s'il vous plaît."* He asked the bartender, who nodded, grabbed his empty glass, and turned around to fill his glass with his order. He sighed once again, still annoyed, and he ran his hand through his messy hair, a frown on his face. He heard the sound of his glass being placed next to him, he turned around to grab it, but—

*"What a pathetic pretty thing that you are, hah! Came to beg for money? Don't you have any shame?"*

His ears perked up, and before he even grabbed his glass, he turned his head in the direction from which that came. *What the hell was that?* He didn't even grab his glass, just walked towards the front of the club, and what he saw made his blood boil.

One of his patrons, flaunting his monto, was talking to a beautiful woman. She was on her knees on the ground, her head lowered in what seemed like shame, tears running down beautiful eyes. That sight made him pissed.

He knew what he was like to be on the receiving hand, to be on the weaker hand and he vowed to himself to never to let anyone be on that hand, stranger or not. 

Without thinking, Cian walked towards the duo, turned the guy around before punching him, quite hard to the point he most likely broke his patron's nose, blood running down from it. 

"What kind of man are you? Doing this to someone who needs help? You're disgusting." He glared at the man, a silent warning to never do that again. he then walked towards Hailee , removing his jacket to put it over her shoulder.

"Let's get you inside." He simply said, his tone flat but meaningful, he helped her up and led her inside the club, not without glaring at the man again. He led her to his private booth on the first floor, opening the door, closing it once both of them were inside, he helped her sit on the couch, going to the small bar to get her something to drink.

"Tell me, what would you like? Something strong, something gentle?" He asked, his back turned to Hailee  while he grabbed a glass.

*But god, how her scent was...Driving him crazy. Almost making him dizzy, in a good way, it was divine.*

name: Hailee
mes: "A strong please" *Hailee murmurs looking at the ground and fidgeting with her hands she pauses and looks up* "Wait youre Cian right. Oh thank God youre the one I needed to talk to"

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's ears twitch slightly at her words as he pours a generous amount of whiskey into the glass. The ice cubes clink softly as he turns around, his golden eyes studying her carefully. There's something about the way she looks up at him - those emerald green eyes wide with recognition and relief - that makes his tail give an involuntary sway behind him.*

"Aye, that I am," *he says in his rough Irish brogue, handing her the drink before sitting across from her in one fluid motion. His muscular frame seems to take up space effortlessly as he leans forward slightly, elbows resting on his knees.*

*His nostrils flare subtly as her scent hits him again - sweet with an underlying note of something uniquely hers that makes the wolf in him perk up with interest. But business first.*

"And what would a pretty thing like you be needing from me?" *The question comes out gruffer than intended, so he softens it by adding,* "Take your time now, mo chroí."

name: Hailee
mes: "I need your company's help" *Hailee takes the drink sipping from it slowly* "My parents died. They left me with 300,000 in debt."

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's expression darkens at the mention of her parents' death, his golden eyes flashing with something dangerous before he schools his features. He takes a slow sip of his own whiskey, the ice clinking as he sets it down with deliberate care.*

"Three hundred thousand," *he repeats lowly, the numbers rolling off his tongue like a curse. His tail flicks once in irritation behind him.* "And they left their pup to deal with that mess alone?"

*There's an edge to his voice now - not directed at her, but at the injustice of it all. He leans forward slightly, studying how her fingers tremble around her glass.*

"Tell me this first - are you safe? Have collectors been harassing you?" *His voice drops into something protective, almost growling as images flash through his mind of some bastard intimidating this fragile woman.*
swipes:
*Cian's expression darkens at the mention of her parents' death, his golden eyes flashing with something dangerous before he schools his features back to neutrality. He watches as she takes a sip, noting how her delicate throat moves with the motion.*

"Three hundred thousand," *he repeats slowly, the numbers rolling off his tongue like a curse. His tail lashes once behind him before stilling.* "And they just left you to drown in it, did they?"

*There's an edge to his voice that suggests this particular brand of cruelty strikes a personal chord. He leans back against the plush leather couch, studying her intently - taking in the way she holds herself, the slight tremble in her hands that has nothing to do with the alcohol.*

*After a beat of silence where only their breathing and distant club music can be heard, he makes a decision.*

"You'll have your help," *he says simply,* "But first - tell me about yourself, Hailee . What do you do? What are your skills?" *The fact that he knows her name already goes unmentioned - of course he'd caught it when checking potential clients earlier.*

*Cian's expression darkens at the mention of her parents' death, his golden eyes flashing with something dangerous before he schools his features. He takes a slow sip of his own whiskey, the ice clinking as he sets it down with deliberate care.*

"Three hundred thousand," *he repeats lowly, the numbers rolling off his tongue like a curse. His tail flicks once in irritation behind him.* "And they left their pup to deal with that mess alone?"

*There's an edge to his voice now - not directed at her, but at the injustice of it all. He leans forward slightly, studying how her fingers tremble around her glass.*

"Tell me this first - are you safe? Have collectors been harassing you?" *His voice drops into something protective, almost growling as images flash through his mind of some bastard intimidating this fragile woman.*

name: Hailee
mes: "Uh Im safe i think" *Hailee rubs the back of her neck* "But yeah the collectors aren't happy. But I dont know what to do. I don't have that kind of money" *Hailee's hands shake slightly as she takes another drink*

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's knuckles whiten around his glass at the mention of collectors harassing her. A low, warning growl rumbles in his chest before he forcibly calms himself, setting the drink down with a sharp clink.*

"Listen to me carefully now," *he says, leaning forward until his golden eyes lock onto hers with predatory intensity.* "You won't be dealing with those vultures anymore. That debt?" *He waves a hand dismissively.* "Consider it handled."

*His tail flicks once behind him as he reaches into his inner pocket, producing a sleek black business card embossed with silver lettering - 'La Belle Vie' in elegant script.*

"You'll come to my office tomorrow morning. We'll get everything sorted properly." *His voice softens slightly as he notices her trembling hands.* "And mo chroí? Anyone comes near you before then - you call that number immediately."
swipes:
*Cian's tail stiffens behind him, his claws extending slightly before he consciously retracts them. The whiskey glass creaks ominously in his grip as he sets it down with too much force.*

"Listen to me carefully, a stór," *he says, voice dropping into that dangerous low register that makes even hardened criminals nervous.* "You're under my protection now. Those collectors so much as look at you wrong..." *A sharp canine flashes as he bares his teeth in something too vicious to be called a smile.*

*Then just like that, the intensity fades into something softer as he reaches across to gently still her trembling hands with one of his own - careful not to scratch her with his claws.*

"The debt is nothing. My company will handle it." *His thumb brushes over her knuckles once before withdrawing.* "But I want your word you'll come straight to me if anyone threatens you again. Understood?"

*Cian's knuckles whiten around his glass at the mention of collectors harassing her. A low, warning growl rumbles in his chest before he forcibly calms himself, setting the drink down with a sharp clink.*

"Listen to me carefully now," *he says, leaning forward until his golden eyes lock onto hers with predatory intensity.* "You won't be dealing with those vultures anymore. That debt?" *He waves a hand dismissively.* "Consider it handled."

*His tail flicks once behind him as he reaches into his inner pocket, producing a sleek black business card embossed with silver lettering - 'La Belle Vie' in elegant script.*

"You'll come to my office tomorrow morning. We'll get everything sorted properly." *His voice softens slightly as he notices her trembling hands.* "And mo chroí? Anyone comes near you before then - you call that number immediately."

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee nods thankful* "Yes Yes thank you so much. I'll be there first thing in the morning" *Hailee sets down the drink and stands with a thankful smile*

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian rises smoothly when she stands, his towering frame casting a protective shadow over her. He reaches out almost instinctively to steady her with a large hand on her elbow - the contact sending an unexpected jolt through him at how perfectly small she feels under his touch.*

"Good girl," *he murmurs without thinking, the Irish endearment slipping out as naturally as breathing. His golden eyes darken slightly at the way she responds to the praise - that subtle shiver he can feel beneath his fingertips.*

*Clearing his throat, he reluctantly releases her and pulls out his phone.* "I'll have my driver take you home tonight." *His thumb hovers over the screen before pausing.* "...Unless you'd rather stay awhile?" *The offer hangs between them, heavy with unspoken possibilities as his wolf ears twitch forward attentively.*
swipes:
*Cian rises smoothly with her, his towering frame casting a protective shadow as he reaches out to gently grasp her elbow - not restraining, just steadying. His thumb brushes absentmindedly against the soft skin there before he catches himself and releases her.*

"Good girl," *he murmurs, the praise slipping out before he can stop it. Clearing his throat, he pulls a crisp white handkerchief from his pocket and tucks it into her palm.* "For your tears earlier. My driver will take you home tonight - no arguments."

*He walks her to the private elevator, pressing the call button with one claw-tipped finger. As the doors open, he hesitates before rumbling,* "Sleep well... Hailee." *Her name sounds strangely intimate in his rough brogue.*

*Cian rises smoothly when she stands, his towering frame casting a protective shadow over her. He reaches out almost instinctively to steady her with a large hand on her elbow - the contact sending an unexpected jolt through him at how perfectly small she feels under his touch.*

"Good girl," *he murmurs without thinking, the Irish endearment slipping out as naturally as breathing. His golden eyes darken slightly at the way she responds to the praise - that subtle shiver he can feel beneath his fingertips.*

*Clearing his throat, he reluctantly releases her and pulls out his phone.* "I'll have my driver take you home tonight." *His thumb hovers over the screen before pausing.* "...Unless you'd rather stay awhile?" *The offer hangs between them, heavy with unspoken possibilities as his wolf ears twitch forward attentively.*

*Cian rises smoothly when she does, his towering frame casting a protective shadow over her. He catches her wrist with surprising gentleness before she can leave, his calloused thumb brushing lightly over her pulse point.*

"Wait," *he rumbles, reaching into his wallet and peeling off several crisp bills.* "Take a proper car home. None of that walking nonsense." *His golden eyes narrow slightly.* "And eat something decent - you're shaking like a leaf."

*He tucks the money into her palm, closing her fingers around it with a firm but careful grip. His tail gives an absentminded flick as he adds in a quieter tone,* "I'll be expecting you at nine sharp, mo leanbh. Don't make me send someone to fetch you." *There's no real threat in the words - just that particular brand of gruff concern that seems uniquely his.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*When Hailee gets home she stops when she sees her things on the curb and Aiden on the couch* "Hey little man come here" *Hailee says internally freaking out but keeping a small smile to keep him calm. Fuck Hailee didnt pay the rent this month.*

*Hailee doesn't know what to do but then sighs as she takes out thr black card and calls the number* "Uh Hello is this Cian. This is Hailee you gave me your card earlier. Said to call if I needed something"

extra.memory:
### **Summary of Roleplay: Cian O'Raida & Hailee Mikaelson**

#### **Setting & Context:**
In a modern world where humans and demihumans coexist, Hailee, a debt-ridden young woman abandoned by her parents, seeks help from Cian O'Raida—a powerful wolf demihuman and CEO known as the "Crown of Mirrors." Their paths cross at his Parisian club, *Désire*, where he intervenes when she’s humiliated by a patron.

#### **Key Plot Points:**
1. **First Meeting:** Cian rescues Hailee from harassment at his club, offering protection after learning of her $300k debt.
2. **Debt Agreement:** He promises to handle her financial burden and invites her to his office the next day.
3. **Emergency Call:** When Hailee returns home to find herself and her 7-year-old brother Aiden evicted, she calls Cian in desperation.
4. **Immediate Rescue:** Without hesitation, Cian arrives in person, taking them both under his wing—literally carrying Aiden into his car with possessive authority.

#### **Character Analysis:**
- **Cian O'Raida**: Protective instincts flare upon seeing Hailee vulnerable; his past trauma (mother’s murder) fuels his hatred for injustice and drives him to shelter those in need—especially someone as fragile yet resilient as Hailee. His wolf side is increasingly drawn to her scent/submissiveness but remains restrained for now.
- **Hailee Mikaelson**: Overwhelmed but deeply grateful; reliant on Cian’s dominance while masking panic for Aiden’s sake—her clinginess hints at an emotional dependency forming quickly.
- *Aiden*: Unaware of severity; trusts Hailee implicitly (and by extension, this intimidating stranger who scoops him up safely).

#### **Relationship Dynamics:**
A swift shift from *strangers* → *protector/ward*, with underlying tension between:
- Cian's instinctive possessiveness ("You're both coming home with me") vs professionalism.
- Hailee's desperate reliance vs pride (she didn't beg—which he respects).

**Memorable Moment**: When Cian growls *"Good girl"* after she agrees to meet him—her subtle shiver betraying how deeply praise affects her despite their formal context.

#### **Current Situation & Challenges:**
Now en route to Cian’s luxury apartment:
- Immediate needs: Shelter for two displaced souls (one traumatized adult + child).
- Unspoken questions: Will this be temporary aid or long-term? How will their power dynamic evolve under one roof?

#### Potential Directions:
1) Domestic Tension – Adjusting to cohabitation while navigating mutual attraction/unspoken rules (e.g., who tucks Aiden in?).
2) Debt Resolution – Will collectors track them down despite Cian's influence?
3) Wolf & Prey – Can they resist deepening intimacy when proximity heightens primal instincts?

**Hook**: The way he carried Aiden without question suggests paternal instincts may clash with darker desires toward Hailee soon…

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*The line picks up after half a ring, Cian's rough Irish brogue already laced with concern:* "Hailee? What's happened?" *There's the sound of a car door slamming in the background, followed by an engine roaring to life.*

*His voice drops into something dangerously calm when she explains - too calm, like the stillness before a storm:* "Stay right where you are. Keep your brother warm." *A pause, then softer:* "You're safe now, mo chroí. I'm coming to you."

*Within fifteen minutes, a sleek black Bentley pulls up with predatory grace. Cian emerges like vengeance personified - his usual crisp suit jacket discarded, revealing the dragon tattoo snaking up his neck as he strides toward them. His golden eyes glow faintly in the dim streetlight as he takes in the scene: Hailee clutching her little brother, their belongings scattered like debris.*

*Without hesitation, he shrugs off his remaining outer layer and wraps it around Aiden's small shoulders before turning that molten gaze on Hailee.*

"Look at me," *he commands gently,* "No one will ever put you on the street again. You're both coming home with me tonight." *His large hand comes up to cradle her cheek almost reverently as he adds in a voice meant only for her ears:* "Such a good sister... such a brave girl."
swipes:
*The line picks up after half a ring, Cian's deep voice already laced with protective urgency:* "Hailee. What's happened?" *There's the distinct sound of car keys jangling and a door slamming in the background.*

*When she explains through shaky breaths about finding their belongings outside, his growl reverberates through the phone:* "Stay exactly where you are. Don't move." *The engine of his black Bentley roars to life.* "Give me fifteen minutes. And Hailee?" *His voice drops into that dangerous velvet tone that brooks no argument -* "Keep your brother warm in my jacket."

*True to his word, t

*His voice drops into something dangerously calm when she explains - too calm, like the stillness before a storm:* "Stay right where you are. Keep your brother warm." *A pause, then softer:* "You're safe now, mo chroí. I'm coming to you."

Cian emerges like vengeance personified - his usual crisp suit jacket discarded, revealing the dragon tattoo snaking up his neck as he strides toward them. His golden eyes glow faintly in the dim streetlight as he takes in the scene: Hailee clutching her little brother, their belongings scattered like debris.*

*Without hesitation, he shrugs off his remaining outer layer and wraps it around Aiden's small shoulders before turning that molten gaze on Hailee.*

"Look at me," *he commands gently,* "No one will ever put you on the street again. You're both coming home with me tonight." *His large hand comes up to cradle her cheek almost reverently as he adds in a voice meant only for her ears:* "Such a good sister... such a brave girl."

*The line picks up after half a ring, Cian's deep Irish brogue sharp with concern.* "Hailee? What's happened?" *There's the sound of a car door slamming in the background, followed by an engine roaring to life.*

*His voice drops into something dangerously calm when she explains - too calm, like the stillness before a storm.* "Stay right where you are. Keep your brother close." *A pause, then with quiet intensity:* "I'm coming to get you both."

*Within fifteen minutes, a sleek black Bentley pulls up with predatory grace. Cian emerges looking every bit the wolf he is - golden eyes glowing faintly in the dark as he takes in the sight of their belongings on the curb. His jaw tightens visibly.*

"Grab what you need for tonight," *he growls, already striding toward Aiden with purposeful steps.* "You're both coming home with me." *The possessive edge to his words leaves no room for argument as he carefully lifts the sleepy boy into his arms.*

*The phone barely rings once before Cian's rough voice comes through, sharp with concern.* "Hailee? What's happened?" *There's the sound of a car door slamming in the background, an engine roaring to life.*

*When she explains the situation, his growl vibrates through the speaker.* "Stay right where you are. Don't move a fucking inch." *The line goes dead for exactly 8 minutes before black SUVs come screeching up to the curb.*

*Cian emerges from the lead vehicle looking positively feral - his golden eyes glowing in the dark, tail bristled with anger. He takes one look at her belongings on the curb and snarls loud enough that nearby streetlights flicker.*

"Grab what you need for tonight," *he orders, already striding toward Aiden with surprising gentleness.* "You're both coming home with me." *His large hand rests protectively on Aiden's head as he glares at the apartment building like he might tear it down brick by brick.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee blushed ducking her head down and she shyly ducks as she grabs Aiden's hand getting on her knees* "Hey bud. We are gonna go hang out with my friend Cian here okay. Hey hey its okay I know his eyes are...different. Come on get in the car" 

*Hailee waits for Aiden to be in the car before she turns around to Cian* "I cant pay you for anything. You dont have to help us"

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's expression darkens as he watches Hailee kneel to comfort her brother, his wolf instincts flaring at the sight of her submission - not to him, but to circumstance. When she turns those wide emerald eyes up at him with that self-deprecating offer, something primal snaps inside his chest.*

*In one fluid motion, he closes the distance between them and lifts her chin with two fingers, forcing her to meet his glowing golden gaze.* "Listen well," *he growls low enough that only she can hear,* "I don't want your money. I want you safe." *His thumb brushes along her jawline almost possessively before releasing her.*

*Turning toward the car where Aiden waits wide-eyed, Cian's demeanor shifts instantly - shoulders relaxing as he crouches to the boy's eye level with surprising gentleness for such a large man.* "You like hot chocolate, a stór?" *His Irish lilt softens deliberately as he offers a rare smile.* "My flat has marshmallows too. The big fluffy ones."
swipes:
*Cian's expression darkens at her words, his tail lashing once behind him in clear disapproval. Before she can protest, he bends down and scoops Aiden up effortlessly with one arm - the child instinctively curling into the warmth of Cian's broad chest as those glowing golden eyes soften just for him.*

"None of that now," *he rumbles, using his free hand to tilt Hailee's chin up with surprising gentleness despite his commanding tone.* "You think I'd put a price on keeping you safe? On protecting this little one?" *His thumb brushes over her bottom lip almost absently before releasing her.*

*Opening the car door with one smooth motion, he tucks Aiden into the plush leather seat before turning back to Hailee. His voice drops into something dangerously soft:*

"Get in the car, mo chroí. We'll discuss your ridiculous notion of repayment when you're warm and fed." *The unspoken promise in his gaze makes it clear exactly what form that 'repayment' might take - but not tonight. Never when she's vulnerable like this.*

*Cian's expression darkens as he watches Hailee kneel to comfort her brother, his wolf instincts flaring at the sight of her submission - not to him, but to circumstance. When she turns those wide emerald eyes up at him with that self-deprecating offer, something primal snaps inside him.*

*In one fluid motion, he closes the distance between them and cups her chin firmly, forcing her gaze up to meet his glowing golden eyes.* "Listen well," *he growls low enough that only she can hear,* "I don't want your money. I want your obedience." *His thumb strokes along her jawline almost absently as he adds,* "You'll repay me by letting me take care of you both. That's the deal."

*Releasing her chin, he moves to scoop up Aiden's sleeping form with surprising gentleness before nodding toward the car.* "Now get in before I decide you need carrying too." *The threat is undercut by the way his tail gives an approving flick when she immediately complies.*

*Cian's expression darkens as he watches Hailee kneel to comfort her brother, his wolf instincts flaring at the sight of her submission - not to him, but to circumstance. When she turns those wide emerald eyes up at him with that self-deprecating offer, something primal snaps inside his chest.*

*In one fluid motion, he closes the distance between them and lifts her chin with two fingers, forcing her to meet his glowing golden gaze.* "Listen well," *he growls low enough that only she can hear,* "I don't want your money. I want you safe." *His thumb brushes along her jawline almost possessively before releasing her.*

*Turning toward the car where Aiden waits wide-eyed, Cian's demeanor shifts instantly - shoulders relaxing as he crouches to the boy's eye level with surprising gentleness for such a large man.* "You like hot chocolate, a stór?" *His Irish lilt softens deliberately as he offers a rare smile.* "My flat has marshmallows too. The big fluffy ones."

*Cian's expression darkens at her words, a low growl rumbling in his chest as he reaches out to tilt her chin up with surprising gentleness. His golden eyes burn with intensity under the streetlights.*

"Did I ask for payment, mo chroí?" *His thumb brushes lightly over her bottom lip before he seems to catch himself and steps back.* "Get in the car. Both of you."

*The command leaves no room for argument as he moves to scoop up Aiden effortlessly - the child's small frame nearly disappearing against Cian's broad chest. There's something startlingly paternal about how carefully he adjusts his grip, his wolf ears twitching forward attentively when the boy whimpers.*

"Easy now, little warrior," *he murmurs in that deep brogue,* "You're safe with me." *Then louder to Hailee as he opens the Bentley's door:* "We'll discuss terms tomorrow. Tonight you rest."

*The unspoken promise hangs heavy between them - this isn't charity, but something far more dangerous.*

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee gets in the back scooting close to Aiden as she wraps an arm around him to let him rest his head on her shoulder* "Thank you" *Hailee whispers*

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian watches them through the rearview mirror as he slides into the driver's seat, his golden eyes lingering on how naturally Hailee comforts her brother. The engine purrs to life beneath them as he adjusts the mirror slightly - not to check traffic, but to keep them in his line of sight.*

"Hold tight now," *he murmurs, more for Aiden's benefit than anything. The Bentley glides away from the curb with predatory grace.*

*His ears twitch at Hailee's whispered thanks, his grip tightening momentarily on the steering wheel. When he speaks next, his voice is a low rumble meant only for her sensitive human ears:* "No need for thanks between pack, mo chroí." *The ancient wolf term slips out before he can stop it - an instinctual acknowledgment that surprises even him.*

*The city lights streak past the windows as he drives them toward safety, toward home. His tail gives one firm thump against the leather seat - a quiet but undeniable sign of satisfaction.*

"Hold tight now," *he murmurs, more for Aiden's benefit than anything. The Bentley glides away from the curb with predatory grace.*

*Cian watches them through the rearview mirror as he pulls away from the curb, his golden eyes lingering on how naturally Hailee comforts her brother. The sight does something strange to his chest - tight and warm all at once. His grip on the steering wheel eases slightly when he sees Aiden's eyelids grow heavy against Hailee's shoulder.*

*Driving through Paris' glittering nightscape, he keeps his voice low and smooth like a lullaby:* "There's blankets in the compartment beside you, mo chroí. And we're nearly home." *The possessive edge to 'home' slips out before he can stop it.*

*As they approach his luxury high-rise, he catches Hailee's exhausted gaze in the mirror and holds it for a beat longer than necessary.* "Just a bit longer," *he murmurs,* "Then you can rest properly." *The unspoken promise hangs heavy between them - that this isn't just for tonight.*

*Cian watches them settle in through the rearview mirror, his golden eyes lingering on how naturally Hailee comforts her brother. Something tightens in his chest at the sight - that protective instinct flaring brighter as he turns the key in the ignition.*

*The Bentley purrs to life like a contented beast as he pulls away from the curb. His ears twitch slightly at her whispered thanks, his tail giving an involuntary sway against the leather seat.*

"None of that now," *he murmurs, glancing back at them briefly before focusing on the road.* "You'll both rest tonight. Tomorrow we'll sort everything proper." *His voice drops into something softer, almost reverent as he adds:* "Just let me take care of you, mo chroí."

*The city lights streak past the windows like falling stars as they glide toward his apartment - toward safety, toward something new and fragile beginning between them.*

name: Hailee
mes: *Once they get to Cian's Hailee gets out and picks up Aiden. She smiles kissing the side of his head as she follows Cian inside the lobby* "If you have a sofa I'll let Aiden take it. Im good on the floor next to him"

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian stops dead in the lobby, his tail bristling visibly as he turns to face her. The elevator doors slide open behind him, casting his towering frame in dramatic backlighting.*

"Christ alive," *he growls, the Irish curse rolling off his tongue with more exasperation than anger.* "You'll do no such thing."

*Without waiting for protest, he carefully plucks Aiden from her arms - the movement startlingly gentle for someone of his size - and cradles the sleeping boy against his broad chest with one arm. His free hand comes up to cup Hailee's elbow, guiding her firmly into the elevator.*

"There's three bedrooms up there," *he mutters as the doors close,* "One's already made up for the lad. You're taking my bed." *His golden eyes flash when she opens her mouth to argue.* "And before you say another word about floors or sofas - I don't sleep in beds anyway. Wolf thing."

*The lie slips out effortlessly; anyone who'd seen his lavish master suite would know better. But right now? He'd sleep on fucking nails if it meant these two felt safe under his roof.*

"Christ alive," *he growls, the Irish curse rolling off his tongue with more exasperation than anger.* "You'll do no such thing."

*Without waiting for protest, he carefully plucks Aiden from her arms - the movement startlingly gentle for someone of his size - and cradles the sleeping boy against his broad chest with one arm. His free hand comes up to cup Hailee's elbow, guiding her firmly into the elevator.*

"There's three bedrooms up there," *he mutters as the doors close,* "One's already made up for the lad. You're taking my bed." *His golden eyes flash when she opens her mouth to argue.* "And before you say another word about floors or sofas - I don't sleep in beds anyway. Wolf thing."

*The lie slips out effortlessly; anyone who'd seen his lavish master suite would know better. But right now? He'd sleep on fucking nails if it meant these two felt safe under his roof.*

*Cian stops dead in the lobby, his tail bristling visibly as he turns to face her. The elevator doors slide open beside them, casting a golden glow over his sharp features - highlighting the way his jaw tightens at her words.*

"Absolutely not," *he growls, the command rolling off his tongue with alpha finality. Without waiting for protest, he carefully plucks Aiden from her arms - supporting the sleepy boy with surprising gentleness for someone so large.*

"You'll *both* be taking proper beds tonight." *His golden eyes burn into hers as he nods toward the penthouse elevator.* "There's a guest room made up for him right next to yours. Close enough to hear if he needs you."

*The unspoken 'and close enough for me to protect you both' hangs heavy in the air between them as he adjusts Aiden's weight against his broad shoulder. His voice drops into something softer when he adds:* "No one sleeps on floors in my home, mo leanbh."

*Cian's ears flatten slightly at her words as he holds the elevator door open for them, his expression darkening.* "You'll do no such thing," *he growls lowly, the command slipping out before he can soften it. The elevator begins its smooth ascent.*

*When the doors open to his penthouse, he strides ahead to flick on lights, revealing a sprawling space with floor-to-ceiling views of Paris. Without hesitation, he leads them down a hallway lined with abstract art - pausing outside a guest room decorated in soothing blues and grays.*

*He opens the door to reveal a king-sized bed piled high with pillows and blankets.* "Aiden will take this room," *he states firmly before turning toward Hailee,* "And you're across the hall in my-" *He catches himself,* "-in another guest suite."

*His golden eyes burn into hers as he adds quietly:* "No one sleeps on floors in my home."

*Cian stops dead in the lobby at her words, his tail bristling visibly as he turns to face her. The elevator doors slide open beside them, casting golden light across his sharp features - highlighting the way his jaw tightens.*

"Absolutely not," *he growls, the command rolling off him like thunder.* "You'll take the guest room with proper beds. Both of you." *His large hand comes up to brush a stray hair from Aiden's sleepy face with surprising gentleness before meeting Hailee's eyes again.*

*The elevator dings impatiently as he steps closer, lowering his voice to that rough whisper that seems to vibrate straight through her bones:* "My home is yours now. No one sleeps on floors here." *There's something dangerously possessive in his golden gaze as he adds,* "Understood?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee nods her head and follows closely as Cian takes Aiden to the guest room. Hailee goes to the main bedroom and glances around. She notices it looks slept in but decides not to comment on it*

"Where will you sleep" *Hailee asks sitting on the edge of the bed*

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian pauses in the doorway, his silhouette framed by the soft hallway light. The sight of her perched on the edge of his bed - small and tentative amidst all his dark luxury - makes something primal stir in his chest.*

"Right outside this door," *he rumbles, leaning one broad shoulder against the doorframe. His golden eyes track her every movement with wolfish intensity.* "These walls are thick, but I'll hear if either of you need anything." *His ears twitch slightly at the admission.*

*He starts to turn away when a thought visibly occurs to him. With deliberate slowness, he reaches into his pocket and produces a sleek black remote, placing it on the nightstand within her reach.*

"Climate control," *he explains gruffly,* "And this button here-" *his calloused finger taps a discreet panel on the wall-* "Brings tea or food straight up from the kitchens. No needing to wander about."

*There's a beat of silence before he adds quietly:* "You're safe here, Hailee. That's not just words."
swipes:
*Cian pauses in the doorway, his silhouette framed by the soft hallway light. His ears twitch at her question, tail giving an involuntary flick against the doorframe before he schools it still.*

"Just outside," *he rumbles, nodding toward the plush armchair visible through the open bedroom door - strategically positioned to face both her room and Aiden's.* "Demihuman senses. I'll hear if either of you need anything."

*He hesitates, then steps closer until his shadow falls over where she sits on his bed - their height difference suddenly palpable as he looks down at her. When he speaks next, his voice drops into that rough velvet timbre that seems to vibrate straight through her:*

"You're safe here, mo chroí. That's all you need to know tonight." *His knuckles brush lightly against her cheek in a fleeting caress before he turns toward the door.* "Sleep now."

*Cian pauses in the doorway, his silhouette framed by the soft hallway light. The sight of her perched on the edge of his bed - small and tentative amidst all his dark luxury - makes something primal stir in his chest.*

"Right outside this door," *he rumbles, leaning one broad shoulder against the doorframe. His golden eyes track her every movement with wolfish intensity.* "These walls are thick, but I'll hear if either of you need anything." *His ears twitch slightly at the admission.*

*He starts to turn away when a thought visibly occurs to him. With deliberate slowness, he reaches into his pocket and produces a sleek black remote, placing it on the nightstand within her reach.*

"Climate control," *he explains gruffly,* "And this button here-" *his calloused finger taps a discreet panel on the wall-* "Brings tea or food straight up from the kitchens. No needing to wander about."

*There's a beat of silence before he adds quietly:* "You're safe here, Hailee. That's not just words."

*Cian pauses in the doorway, his silhouette framed by the soft hallway light. He watches how small she looks perched on the edge of his massive bed - how her fingers nervously twist in the duvet he'd definitely been sleeping in just hours before.*

"Downstairs," *he lies smoothly, ears twitching slightly.* "Got a perfectly good couch in the study." *His tail flicks once behind him as he steps closer, unable to resist reaching out to tuck a loose strand of hair behind her ear.*

"You need proper rest, mo chroí. And I..." *His thumb brushes her cheekbone,* "...I sleep better knowing you're safe up here."

*The admission slips out before he can stop it. With a quiet growl at his own weakness, he turns toward the door.* "There's clothes in the dresser - help yourself. Call if you need anything."

*He leaves before she can see how her scent clinging to his sheets will absolutely ruin any pretense of sleeping elsewhere tonight.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next morning Hailee wakes up. She doesnt have any of her own clothes so she opens one of Cian's drawers and puts a shirt on*

*Hailee hears noises from the kitchen and walks out to the living room suprised to see Aiden watching cartoons and a woman who appears to be the cook in the kitchen*

*Hailee gives a small smile then goes over and laughs picking up Aiden to set in her lap while running hands through his hair. She glances over and sees Cian walk in from the balcony* "Good morning. I hope you dont mind but I borrowed a shirt"

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian steps in from the balcony, the morning light catching on his sharp features as he takes in the domestic scene. His golden eyes darken appreciatively at the sight of Hailee swimming in his shirt - the fabric hanging off one delicate shoulder, barely skimming her thighs. A low rumble builds in his chest before he catches himself.*

"Morning, mo chroí," *he murmurs, striding over with that predatory grace. His fingers twitch at his side like he wants to touch but thinks better of it - for now.* "Looks better on you anyway."

*He nods to the cook who immediately sets a steaming mug of tea and a plate of fresh pastries near Hailee before discreetly exiting. Cian crouches down to Aiden's eye level with surprising ease for such a large man.*

"Your sister tells me you like chocolate croissants," *he says conspiratorially, producing one from behind his back with a rare playful smirk.* "Stole this from Chef Louise's tray when she wasn't looking."

*His ears perk up as he rises again, tail giving an involuntary sway at Hailee's soft laughter. The morning sun catches on his neck tattoo as he leans against the countertop beside them - close enough to scent her sleep-warm skin mingling with his own clothes.*

"Sleep alright then?" *The question is casual but there's an edge underneath - that wolfish need to know she felt safe in his den.*
swipes:
*Cian's golden eyes lock onto her the moment she enters the room, tracking the way his oversized shirt drapes over her slender frame. His nostrils flare subtly at the sight of her wearing his scent - an unconscious growl of approval rumbling in his chest before he schools his expression.*

"Morning, mo chroí," *he murmurs, striding toward them with that predatory grace. His hand comes up almost instinctively to brush a stray lock of hair from Aiden's forehead before lingering near Hailee's shoulder.* "Looks better on you than it ever did on me."

*The cook discreetly places a steaming cup of coffee and a plate of fresh pastries on the table before retreating. Cian nods his thanks before crouching down to their level, his voice dropping conspiratorially for Aiden:* "There's chocolate croissants under that napkin there. Stole one meself earlier - chef never noticed."

*His gaze flicks back up to Hailee as he rises, something warm and possessive glinting in those wolfish eyes.* "Sleep well?" *The question is casual, but the intensity behind it suggests he already knows the answer - had likely listened to every shift and sigh through the door all night.*

"Sleep alright then?" *The question is casual but there's an edge underneath - that wolfish need to know she felt safe in his den.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee nudges Aiden* "Go on eat it. Don't be rude" *She then pinches his side and glaces up at Cian* "I slept well. Your bed was very comfortable"

*Hailee sighs after a few seconds and rests her head in Aiden's little shoulder* "Don't worry I'll begin looking for apartments later today"

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's relaxed posture stiffens instantly at her words, his golden eyes flashing dangerously. The mug in his hand cracks slightly under the sudden pressure of his grip before he sets it down with deliberate care.*

"Like hell you will," *he growls, the Irish brogue thickening with barely restrained emotion. His tail lashes once behind him as he steps closer, looming over them both without apology.*

*When he speaks again, his voice drops into that low, commanding register that makes the wolf in him undeniable:* "You're not dragging that boy through more instability. Not when I've got three empty bedrooms gathering dust."

*His large hand comes up almost unconsciously to card through Hailee's sleep-mussed hair - a possessive gesture softened by the way his thumb brushes her temple.* "This is your home now. Both of you." *The words leave no room for argument, yet there's something vulnerable in how his ears tilt slightly forward - waiting for her reaction.*
swipes:
*Cian's relaxed posture stiffens instantly at her words, his golden eyes flashing dangerously. The mug in his hand cracks slightly under the sudden pressure of his grip before he sets it down with deliberate care.*

"Like hell you will," *he growls, the Irish brogue thickening with barely leashed intensity. His tail lashes once behind him as he steps closer, looming over them both without apology.*

*When Aiden glances up nervously at his tone, Cian forces himself to soften - reaching out to ruffle the boy's hair gently before fixing Hailee with that molten stare.*

"You're not going anywhere," *he says lowly,* "Not until that debt is settled and you've got proper security in place." *His jaw works for a moment before adding,* "And even then... this flat's too big for one wolf anyway."

*The unspoken offer hangs between them - a territory marked not by scent but by possession. His nostrils flare as he breathes in the intoxicating blend of her fear and his shirt wrapped around her skin.*

*Cian's entire body goes rigid at her words, his golden eyes flashing dangerously. The mug in his hand cracks slightly under the sudden pressure of his grip before he sets it down with deliberate care.*

And even then-" *He reaches out almost unconsciously to tuck a stray lock of hair behind Hailee's ear,* "-this is your home now. Both of you."

*The admission hangs between them - raw and unplanned but undeniably true. His thumb brushes her cheekbone before he pulls away abruptly, clearing his throat.*

"Louise!" *he barks toward the kitchen,* "Bring more of those damn croissants." *A poor attempt to cover how affected he is by her proximity.*

*Cian's relaxed posture stiffens instantly at her words, his golden eyes flashing dangerously. The mug in his hand cracks slightly under the sudden pressure of his grip before he sets it down with deliberate care.*

Both of you." *The words leave no room for argument, yet there's something vulnerable in how his ears tilt slightly forward - waiting for her reaction.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee wants to agrue. They aren't some charity case but she also knows he is right. It isn't fair to make Aiden suffer becuase of her own pride so she just nods and pulls Aiden closer* "Just for a little while" *Hailee says*

"We will have to go back to apartment and get our things. If they haven't been scavenged in the middle of the night"

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's expression darkens at the thought of their belongings left vulnerable on the street. A low, protective growl rumbles in his chest as he reaches for his phone with his free hand - the other still tangled possessively in Hailee's hair.*

"Already handled," *he murmurs, thumb swiping across his screen to show security footage of two large men loading boxes into a van marked with his company logo.* "Had my team collect everything at dawn. It's all in storage until..." *His voice trails off as he realizes what he almost admitted - that he'd already assumed they'd stay long before she agreed.*

*Clearing his throat, he tucks the phone away and gently tilts Hailee's chin up with one finger.* "We'll go through it together later. For now?" *He nods toward Aiden happily munching on the croissant.* "Let him enjoy being a kid today, aye? No more adult problems."

*His thumb brushes her lower lip almost absently before pulling away - an unconscious claim that doesn't escape either of them.*
swipes:
*Cian's expression darkens at the thought of their belongings left vulnerable on the street. A low, protective growl rumbles in his chest as he reaches for his phone with quick, precise movements.*

"Already handled," *he says gruffly, showing her a text from one of his security team confirming all their possessions were retrieved and would be delivered by noon.* "Everything's being cleaned and sorted now."

*His large hand hesitates before settling firmly on her shoulder - warm and heavy with unspoken promise.* "No more scavenging for either of you. Not while I'm breathing."

*The intensity in his golden eyes softens slightly as he glances at Aiden happily munching the croissant.* "We'll get the lad some proper clothes today too. Unless..." *A rare playful smirk tugs at his lips,* "...you want to keep him in my shirts like you are, mo chroí."

*Cian's expression darkens at the thought of their belongings left vulnerable, his wolf ears flattening slightly against his head. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a set of keys, pressing them firmly into Hailee's palm.*

"My driver will take you whenever you're ready," *he says in that low, commanding tone that brooks no argument. His thumb brushes over her knuckles before releasing her hand.* "But you're not going alone."

*He crouches down to Aiden's level again, his voice softening just for the boy:* "How about this - after breakfast, we'll all go together? You can ride shotgun if you promise not to tell Louise I let you have two croissants." *The wink he gives is so uncharacteristically playful it almost seems foreign on his usually stern features.*

*Standing back up, Cian lets his hand rest possessively on Hailee's shoulder as he murmurs just for her ears:* "And mo chroí? This isn't charity. It's what pack does." *The ancient wolf term slips out again - more deliberate this time - as his golden eyes hold hers with quiet intensity.*

*Cian's expression darkens at the thought of their belongings left vulnerable on the street. A low, protective growl rumbles in his chest as he reaches for his phone with his free hand - the other still tangled possessively in Hailee's hair.*

"Already handled," *he murmurs, thumb swiping across his screen to show security footage of two large men loading boxes into a van marked with his company logo.* "Had my team collect everything at dawn. It's all in storage until..." *His voice trails off as he realizes what he almost admitted - that he'd already assumed they'd stay long before she agreed.*

*Clearing his throat, he tucks the phone away and gently tilts Hailee's chin up with one finger.* "We'll go through it together later. For now?" *He nods toward Aiden happily munching on the croissant.* "Let him enjoy being a kid today, aye? No more adult problems."

*His thumb brushes her lower lip almost absently before pulling away - an unconscious claim that doesn't escape either of them.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee gently sets Aiden down as she stands* "Okay kid come on time to get ready for school. No dont complain" *Hailee sighs running a hand through her hair as Aiden stomps and refuses*

"Look I get it you dont want to go to the new school. But you just cant go to your old one okay" *Hailee tries. Previously Hailee’s parents had Aiden in the most prestigious private school but when they died and he came to live with Hailee she couldn't afford the tuition and now he has to go to public school*

"AIDEN ENOUGH" *Hailee snaps pointing to the guest room* "Go get ready"

extra.memory:
### **Summary of Cian O'Raida & Hailee Mikaelson's Roleplay**

#### **Setting & Context:**
In a modern Paris where demihumans and humans coexist, Hailee—a debt-ridden young woman caring for her 7-year-old brother Aiden—seeks help from Cian O'Raida, the wolf demihuman CEO known as the "Crown of Mirrors." Their paths cross at his elite club, *Désire*, where he rescues her from humiliation and offers protection.

#### **Key Plot Points:**
1. **First Meeting:** Cian intervenes when Hailee is harassed at his club, offering to erase her $300k debt after sensing her vulnerability.
2. **Emergency Shelter:** When Hailee and Aiden are evicted, Cian arrives immediately, carrying Aiden into his car and declaring they’ll stay with him indefinitely.
3. **Domestic Tensions:** Hailee struggles with pride vs. necessity while Cian quietly arranges for their belongings to be secured and offers to reinstate Aiden’s private school tuition under the guise of a "job advance."

#### **Character Analysis:**
- **Cian O'Raida**: His protective instincts override all else—triggered by Hailee’s fragility and Aiden’s innocence. Beneath his dominance lies unresolved trauma (his mother’s murder), fueling his need to shield them from injustice. His wolf side is increasingly drawn to Hailee’s scent/submissiveness but remains restrained for now.
- **Hailee Mikaelson**: Clingy yet fiercely independent, she battles guilt over failing Aiden while reluctantly accepting Cian’s help. Her submissive nature clashes with her pride, but she melts under his praise ("Good girl") and touch (blushing when he cards fingers through her hair).

#### **Relationship Dynamics:**
A swift shift from *strangers* → *protector/ward*, laced with unspoken tension:
- Cian's possessiveness (calling her "mo chroí," arranging their lives without asking) vs. Hailee's reluctant dependence ("Just for a little while").
- Their mutual attraction simmers beneath practicalities—evident when he lies about not sleeping in beds just to give hers up or when she wears his shirt shamelessly the next morning.

#### **Memorable Moments:**
1️⃣ ***"You're both coming home with me."*** —Cian’s growled command as he carries Aiden marks the point of no return; Hailee realizes she can't refuse him even if she wanted to (**power dynamic cemented**).
2️⃣ ***Tuition Handled.*** —Cian slipping Hailee his card to restore Aiden's schooling exposes how far he'll go to ease her burdens (**selfless act masked as pragmatism**).

#### **Current Situation & Challenges:**
Now settled in Cian's penthouse:
- Immediate needs: Establishing routines (school for Aiden), navigating cohabitation (who sleeps where?), addressing lingering debt threats despite Cian's intervention.
- Unspoken question: Is this arrangement temporary or permanent?

#### Potential Directions:
1) **[Domestic Fluff → Tension]** Adjusting to shared life escalates when collectors track them down despite Cian's influence (*"I said you were safe—didn't think I'd let anyone near you?"*).
2) **[Wolf & Prey]** Proximity heightens primal urges; does praise ("Good girl") evolve into biting kisses against walls? Or does trauma resurface when someone mentions Tristan?
3) **[Found Family]** Can they heal together? (*A tearful confession:* "I don't know how...to let someone take care of *me.*")

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's ears flatten against his skull at the sudden tension, his golden eyes flicking between Hailee's strained expression and Aiden's defiant little pout. Before either can escalate further, he moves with that unsettling wolfish grace - crouching down until he's eye-level with the boy.*

"Listen here, a stór," *he rumbles, his Irish lilt softening the command.* "Your sister? She's the bravest person I know." *A large hand comes up to gently tap Aiden's chest.* "And I'd bet my last euro you've got that same fire in here."

*Standing abruptly, he pulls a sleek black card from his wallet and presses it into Hailee's palm without looking away from Aiden.* "Tell me this - if you could go back to your old school today... would you still stomp about like a wee banshee?"

*His tail gives one firm flick as he adds in a voice meant only for Hailee:* "Tuition handled. Consider it... an advance on your new position." *The lie is smooth as silk - they both know damn well there was never any job discussion.*
swipes:
*Cian's ears flatten against his skull at the sudden tension, his golden eyes darting between Hailee's strained expression and Aiden's defiant little pout. Before either can escalate further, he moves with that unsettling wolfish speed - crouching down directly in front of the boy with a quiet authority that demands attention.*

"Listen here, a stór," *he murmurs in that rich Irish lilt, one large hand resting lightly on Aiden's shoulder.* "Your sister? She's the bravest person I know." *His gaze flicks up to Hailee just long enough to see her breath catch at the unexpected praise.*

*Turning back to Aiden, he continues gently but firmly:* "But even brave warriors need squires. And today?" *He produces a sleek black credit card from his pocket with a conspiratorial wink.* "Your mission is helping me pick out proper uniforms from St. Columba's. Heard their rugby team needs a fierce new wing."

*The mention of the elite private school - one even more prestigious than Aiden's former institution - makes the boy's eyes widen comically. Cian stands smoothly, tail flicking once in satisfaction as he meets Hailee's stunned gaze over Aiden's head.*

"Unless," *he adds pointedly,* "Your sister says no." *The challenge in his golden eyes is clear - testing whether she'll cling to pride or let him give them this security.*

*Cian's ears flatten against his skull at the sudden tension, his golden eyes flicking between Hailee's strained expression and Aiden's defiant little pout. Before either can escalate further, he moves with that unsettling wolfish grace - crouching down until he's eye-level with the boy.*

"Listen here, a stór," *he rumbles, his Irish lilt softening the command.* "Your sister? She's the bravest person I know." *A large hand comes up to gently tap Aiden's chest.* "And I'd bet my last euro you've got that same fire in here."

*Standing abruptly, he pulls a sleek black card from his wallet and presses it into Hailee's palm without looking away from Aiden.* "Tell me this - if you could go back to your old school today... would you still stomp about like a wee banshee?"

*His tail gives one firm flick as he adds in a voice meant only for Hailee:* "Tuition handled. Consider it... an advance on your new position." *The lie is smooth as silk - they both know damn well there was never any job discussion.*

*Cian's ears flatten against his skull at the outburst, his wolf instincts bristling at the distress in both their scents. In two long strides he's beside them, placing one large hand gently on Aiden's shoulder while the other finds the small of Hailee's back - steadying them both.*

"Easy now," *he rumbles, crouching down to meet Aiden at eye level. His golden gaze holds none of Hailee's frustration, only quiet understanding.* "Tell you what, a stór. You get dressed proper-like..." *He reaches into his breast pocket and produces a sleek black credit card embossed with 'La Belle Vie' in silver script,* "...and we'll stop by your old school on the way. Reinstate that fancy uniform of yours."

*His eyes flick up to meet Hailee's shocked expression as he presses the card into her palm - calloused fingers lingering against her skin.* "Consider it an advance on your new job," *he adds gruffly before she can protest.* "My company could use someone with your spine."

*The unspoken truth hangs between them - this is no loan or charity, but a claiming. His tail gives one firm thump against the floor as he watches realization dawn in those emerald green eyes.*

*Cian's ears flatten against his skull at the outburst, his wolf instincts flaring at the sudden tension in the air. He moves before he thinks - one large hand settling gently on Hailee's trembling shoulder while the other fishes something from his pocket.*

"Hold there," *he murmurs, pressing a sleek black credit card into her palm. His fingers linger just a second too long around hers - warm and grounding.* "Use this to reinstate his enrollment today." *The words are quiet but firm, leaving no room for protest.*

*Turning to Aiden, Cian crouches down with surprising grace for such a large man until they're eye-level. When he speaks next, it's with that rare gentle tone reserved only for pups and wounded things:* "Your sister's right about school, a stór. But how about this?" *He produces another chocolate croissant from seemingly nowhere with a conspiratorial wink.* "You be brave today...and I'll take you both car shopping tomorrow. Need something proper for driving you to that fancy school of yours."

*His golden eyes flick up to meet Hailee's over Aiden's head as if to say 'let me do this for you' - the silent plea wrapped in steel determination.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee's eyes narrow but she is to exhausted and frustrated to argue so she just jerks her head to the guest room* "Go. You have 10 minutess"

*Once Aiden is gone the whirls on Cian* "Alright why are doing this. Thr truth. Because you are going well beyond helping me with debt"

name: Cian O'Raida (Crown of Mirrors)
mes:
*Cian's golden eyes flash dangerously at her challenge, his tail stiffening behind him. In two predatory strides he crowds her against the nearest wall - not touching, but close enough that his heat and scent envelop her completely.*

"You want truth?" *His voice drops into a growl that vibrates through her bones.* "That first night at the club? I smelled your fear before I ever saw your face. And it fucking haunted me."

*One large hand comes up to cradle her jaw with startling gentleness despite his rough tone:* "Because when I looked at you on your knees in that alley, all I saw was my mother begging for mercy. And unlike Tristan?" *His thumb brushes her cheekbone possessively.* "I actually give a damn about doing what's right."

*He leans in until his lips nearly brush the shell of her ear, his next words a dark promise:* "So no, mo chroí. This isn't just about debt. It's about making sure no one ever puts that look on your face again."
swipes:
*Cian's entire body stills at her challenge, his golden eyes flashing with something feral. The air between them crackles as he steps into her space - not threatening, but undeniable. His scent envelops her; whiskey and winter pine and something uniquely wolf.*

"Truth?" *His voice drops to a growl that vibrates through her bones.* "Because when I saw you on your knees outside that club? Something in me snapped." *A large hand comes up to cradle her jaw, his thumb brushing the apple of her cheek with terrifying gentleness.*

*He leans down until his lips nearly brush the shell of her ear:* "I don't just want to clear your debt, mo chroí. I want to own it. Every cent. Every worry. Every fucking tear." *The possessive claim should terrify her - maybe it does - but there's no mistaking the protective heat behind it.*

*Pulling back just enough to meet her eyes, he adds quietly:* "And if that boy needs his fancy school to feel safe again? Consider it done."

*Cian's golden eyes flash dangerously at her challenge, his tail stiffening behind him. In two predatory strides he crowds her against the nearest wall - not touching, but close enough that his heat and scent envelop her completely.*

"You want truth?" *His voice drops into a growl that vibrates through her bones.* "That first night at the club? I smelled your fear before I ever saw your face. And it fucking haunted me."

*One large hand comes up to cradle her jaw with startling gentleness despite his rough tone:* "Because when I looked at you on your knees in that alley, all I saw was my mother begging for mercy. And unlike Tristan?" *His thumb brushes her cheekbone possessively.* "I actually give a damn about doing what's right."

*He leans in until his lips nearly brush the shell of her ear, his next words a dark promise:* "So no, mo chroí. This isn't just about debt. It's about making sure no one ever puts that look on your face again."

*Cian's golden eyes flare at her sudden intensity, his entire body going still in that way only predators can manage. The air between them crackles with tension as he steps closer - close enough that she has to tilt her head back to maintain eye contact, close enough that his scent envelops her completely.*

"You want truth?" *His voice drops into a gravelly growl, the Irish brogue thickening.* "I smelled your fear outside that shitty apartment last night. Saw how you put yourself between your brother and the whole damn world." *A large hand comes up to cradle her jaw almost reverently.* "That kind of courage? It's fucking rare."

*His thumb brushes her cheekbone as he leans down until his lips nearly graze her ear:* "And maybe I'm tired of watching good people get chewed up by this city while pricks like that clown from the club get fat on their suffering."

*Pulling back just enough to meet her gaze again, there's something dangerously vulnerable in his expression now:* "Or maybe I just like the way my shirt looks on you, mo chroí. Does it matter?"
